messages.title: The EU Vote
messages.content: In harmony with the 74% of Cambridge residents who voted to Remain in last year’s referendum, when the Brexit bill was put before Parliament, Daniel Zeichner MP voted against Britain leaving the EU. Daniel said, “I opposed leaving the EU and voted accordingly. I made a pledge when elected to do my best to represent the interests of Cambridge people in Parliament.”

messages.title: Backing Cambridge's Interests
messages.content: Cambridge has long been an outward-looking, international city. Our universities, research community, and private and public sectors all depend on an open flow of ideas, investment, and people. Leaving the EU seriously challenges this. Cambridge’s place as a world-leading centre of ideas and innovation – without doubt, the Tories’ ‘hard Brexit’ will cost us.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Daniel Zeichner has voted against Britain leaving the EU, in accordance with the 74% of Cambridge residents who voted to remain.
Cambridge’s international ties are crucial for its economic and academic sectors. Leaving the EU will negatively impact this.

Ensuring the best possible terms for market access, protection of research funding, rights for EU citizens, maintenance of high environmental standards, and protection against terrorism and organised crime.

issues.brexitEurope: Daniel Zeichner MP voted against Britain leaving the EU.
issues.economy: Ensuring the best possible terms for market access so companies can buy and sell goods in the world's largest market, making goods cheaper in the shops.
issues.immigration: The rights for EU citizens who have made Cambridge their home and for UK citizens living in EU countries.
issues.lawCrime: Protection of EU-wide agreements to tackle terrorism and organised crime.

community.content:
Access to the Single Market on the best possible terms so companies can buy and sell goods in the world’s largest market, making goods cheaper in the shops.
Protection of research funding for our universities.
The rights for EU citizens who have made Cambridge their home and for UK citizens living in EU countries.
Maintenance of high environmental standards.
Protection of EU-wide agreements to tackle terrorism and organised crime.

quotes.text: “On our membership of the European Union I voted with the vast majority of Cambridge residents and my conscience: to remain”

images.caption: Supported the construction careers day at Cambridge Regional College
Champion foodbank events across Cambridge, including a Tesco collection day
